etymology.description: 大 ‘great’ + 安 ‘peace’ = great peace; also used as a proper name (districts, parks, temples).
etymology.interpretation: Modifier 大 intensifies 安 to denote an ideal of profound tranquility; as a proper noun it names places like Taipei’s Da’an District.

examples.chinese: 愿天下大安(願天下大安)。
examples.english: May the realm be in great peace.

examples.chinese: 我住在台北的大安区(我住在臺北的大安區)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài Táiběi de Dà’ān Qū.
examples.english: I live in Taipei’s Da’an District.

examples.chinese: 我们去大安森林公园散步(我們去大安森林公園散步)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qù Dà’ān Sēnlín Gōngyuán sànbù.
examples.english: We’re going for a walk in Da’an Forest Park.
